H0.text: Linear acceleration is equal to the angular acceleration multiplied by the radius of the rotating object.

H1.text: Equilibrium is equal to the angular acceleration multiplied by the radius of the rotating object.

H2.text: Peak velocity is equal to the angular acceleration multiplied by the radius of a rotating object.

H3.text: Momentum is equal to the angular acceleration multiplied by the radius of the rotating object.

A4.text: The tangential component is given by the angular acceleration α, i.e., the rate of change α=ω˙ of the angular speed ω times the radius r. That is, a_t = rα.
